conclusion: Define variables: ρ (density of water), σ (surface-tension coefficient), g (acceleration of gravity), d (inside diameter of the nozzle), r (radius of the drop).
Calculate weight of the drop: W = (4⁄3)π r³ ρ g.
Calculate surface-tension force holding the drop: Fσ = 2σ π d.
Determine condition for detachment: (4⁄3)π r³ ρ g = 2σ π d.
Derive maximum radius: r_max³ = (3/2) (σ d)/(ρ g) and r_max = [ (3 σ d)/(2 ρ g) ]^{1/3}.
Discuss influence of electrical potential: No electric field acts across the neck, electrostatic contribution is negligible, detachment criterion and radius are not altered.
Conclude final result: r_max = [ (3 σ d)/(2 ρ g) ]^{1/3}.
